title: Epstein affair: French prosecutors announce special team of magistrates to investigate suspected crimes
subhead: The new team will work closely with prosecutors and police with a view to opening investigations into any suspected crimes involving French nationals. This includes the late Jean-Luc Brunel, a former modeling agency executive.

title: Former French envoy to Moscow warns of a new US-Russia convergence
European states say Navalny poisoned with dart frog toxin in Russian prison
In Munich, France and Germany present two visions for Europe while Rubio wants to 'build a new Western century'
subhead: Emmanuel Macron urged Europe on Friday to take pride in itself in the face of the Trump administration's repeated attacks. While highlighting European values, Friedrich Merz reiterated his commitment to the transatlantic relationship.

title: Son of Iran's last shah urges US action as 200,000 supporters rally in Munich
subhead: Reza Pahlavi, who has not returned to Iran since before the 1979 Islamic revolution that ousted the monarchy, told the crowd of around 200,000 people of his supporters that he could lead the country to a 'secular democratic future'

title: As dating fatigue sets in, friends step in as Cupid
subhead: Letting a friend find the best match for you on Tinder or make a PowerPoint presentation about you during a 'pitch dating' event: As romance becomes a team sport, friends are stepping up to the plate.

title: The slow identification of Ukrainian soldiers killed at the front and returned by Russia
subhead: In Odesa, at one of Ukraine's forensic centers equipped for DNA identification, 2,300 bodies – handed over by the Russians under an agreement struck in June 2025 – wait inside refrigerated railway cars to be identified.

Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhead: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: Europe's growing mistrust of the United States
subhead: According to a survey by the European Council on Foreign Relations, the US is no longer seen as a 'necessary partner.'

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.
